[table]
    [tr]  
      [th]Factor[/th]
        [th]Rating[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay Loop[/td]
        [td]6 (At most times, the gunplay and [strike]plasmids[/strike] vigors were pretty fun to use but there was a couple issues I had with the gameplay - which got to the point of hindering my experience. Your mouse sensitivity changes whe you are sprinting. Which is counterintuitive to the open level design which requires you to move around and pick off enemies. You can only carry 2 guns at a time, and in the second half there are hardly any vending machines to buy ammo from. I ran a carbine rifle and handgun the whole game, but later on I was forced to change my weapons of preference because I ran out of bullets in the middle of the ghost fight with nowhere to get bullets from, while Elizabeth threw meds at me while both my guns are zero and I'm out of salts too. [b]And a big -1 for the last tower defence simulator mission. Finally I figured that I was not supposed to use the bird on zeppelins but go in there myself. [/b])[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Narrative[/td]
        [td]5 (My biggest gripe about the narrative was the playable character, and with extension his ending. And no, not just the fact that he has the inane likeability and charisma of a generic Far Cry protagonist. But that he had a backstory that HE KNEW and I didn't. [spoiler]Him selling his daughter and the baptism scene should have been the very first things shown in the game so as to tie it all full circle by the end.[/spoiler] But that information is withheld from the player and things are just built up more and more and more until the very end. I mean, it was FINE. Maybe even pretty good. I liked Elizabeth as a character, and I liked the twist. I just didn't like how they decided to show it.This is the perfect example of a game with a GOOD story but terrible storytelling.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Visuals[/td]
        [td]9 (There's no doubt about the fact that Columbia looks great. The visuals are well done and even the fights with whatever they brought in in place of Big Daddies looked cinematic with that thing jumping around from floating platform to another behind me. It wasn't as stimulating gameplay-wise but it would have proved a good watch for someone watching me play and thinking what a great game I'm playing.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Mechanics[/td]
        [td]6 (I've already talked about the sprint thing. It was a major gripe for me throughout my whole game and I never got used to the clunky mechanics. I would have given it a 7 if not for that. The shooting is fine. The skyline thing was great. It tied in the whole aspect of it being a land in the clouds together. They couldn't have given us Doraemon's Bamboocopter anyway, with the player crashing on invisible walls the whole time - and I think this was integrated well. Wish we had something like this in Rapture with the underwater setting - but it might not have made sense since Rapture is isolated from the water anyway.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Challenge [/td]
        [td]5 (I always start games at Hard difficulty. And this game didn't challenge me half as much as Bioshock's big daddy fights. Most times I felt challenged was because of lack of resources and not well-balanced difficulties. There were hardly any enemies using the Vigors that was a huge missed opportunity. There was no scope of choice in which plasmids/vigors I wanted to equip. Around the last missions I remember the scene literally turned into a tower defense kind of game which was very annoying and soured the experience.)[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Variety[/td]
        [td]5 (Zero flexibility most of the time. But I don't really give that low of a score here just for the sake of effort. I remember I went to the graveyard place while exploring, before triggering the main mission that asks me to go there. There is a tear but I did not get the prompt of Elizabeth opening it. Then, when I went all the way back to talk to a door - now all of a sudden I want to open up her mother's grave and what not. This is what differentiates it from the likes of TW3, where these player agencies were taken into account.) [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Mapping[/td]
        [td]7 (Columbia is very well made. As I said, the skylines tie in the map and gameplay well in together. But the people were weird. It somehow felt more dead at times than Rapture - which was literally dead. The level design in combat arenas was mediocre. But I'll still give the game a kudos to have a pretty memorable map anyway. The fact that it is compared to one of my favorite in-game environments of all time as its predecessor doesn't help the case - where almost every new area felt distinct despite having the same aesthetic. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Soundtrack[/td]
        [td]9 (The music was perfect. Whether the main menu one, or from voxophones lying around. It was very well done and established the setting very well. The combat music was stimulating. The voice acting was well done. While I don't remember any specific soundtrack specifically, I do think I'll be able to point out if someone made me hear any of em again.)[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Interface[/td]
        [td]7 (The main menu looks phenomenal. On the other hand though, there's some things I hated. I use the tab key to open the map or the 'mission menu' or whatever. And here I was locked to use Tab for what I use on Esc and Esc was already doing that anyway. I hate it when games lock keys like these out. I hated that in Just Cause 3 and I hate it now.)[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Pricing & Performance[/td]
        [td]10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Replay Value[/td]
        [td]6[/td]
    [/tr]

    [tr]
        [td]Online/DLC [/td]
        [td]- (I will play the DLCs and update this later)[/td]
    [/tr]

[/table]

[b]SCORE : 6.7/10[/b]

[h1] Bioshock Infinite (Elizabeth Simulator) [/h1]
  É, sem exageros, um dos melhores jogos de todos os tempos. Afinal, ser melhor em tudo requer que não tenha falhas, que seja completo. E BioShock consegue e diria que vai além.
  Você controla Booker DeWitt, um ex-agente de Pinkerton. Para poder pagar suas dívidas, ele recebe a proposta de ir para Columbia, resgatar uma garota (Elizabeth) e, assim, estará quite.

  Este é apenas o início banal de uma história fantástica, com reviravoltas incríveis. Parte dela encontra-se em aproveitar a história ao máximo.
 BioShock Infinite acontece por volta de 1912 em Columbia, uma cidade flutuante e extremamente patriota (ela se considera os “verdadeiros” EUA). Ela é viva, lotada de NPCs (personagens não controláveis) fazendo coisas diferentes, cada um deles. Os gráficos são um show à parte, sem contar os efeitos sonoros. 
  É um shooter, baseado em três pontos: história linear (com exploração que te permite ir mais a fundo), tiroteio e poderes sobrenaturais. Os três estão em Infinite mais fortes do que nunca. Você terá que explorar todo o canto do cenário para adquirir itens e garantir que não morrerá nas batalhas; terá que evoluir suas armas e usar a munição com consciência e deve usar os vigores (os novos “Plasmids”, para quem jogou os outros da série) para, por exemplo, lançar bolas de fogo, corvos, água e até mesmo possuir (no sentido de controlar) objetos.

  Mas a verdadeira atração de BioShock Infinite é Elizabeth. Cerca de 75% do jogo você estará acompanhado dela. Quando se pensa na adição de uma personagem acompanhando o seu, sem dúvida há uma preocupação em como isso afetará a sua diversão, principalmente considerado o fato de que se precisaríamos protegê-la. E aqui justamente o contrário acontece: Elizabeth protege você. Ela o auxilará com itens de tempos em tempos e não precisa ser protegida. Elizabeth inclusive adiciona elementos de gameplay nos combates – por ser uma pessoa especial, ela pode abrir o que chamamos de “fendas”: espécies de portais para um mundo paralelo e trazer, de lá, coisas que podem ajudá-lo em combate.
  O charme de Elizabeth não acaba por aqui. Em vários momentos você se pegará vendo o que ela está fazendo pelo cenário. É incrível a sua programação: ela encostará em paredes enquanto espera pela sua coleta de itens, verificará papéis nas mesas e NPCs espalhados pelo cenário e muito mais. Isso sem contar os fatos “realmente” programados, para que a história avance. Sua expressão facial é simplesmente incrível, sem contar a excelente dublagem de Courtnee Draper.
  BioShock Infinite possui algumas coisas que você sente que foram reaproveitadas dos jogos anteriores: principalmente os inimigos. A movimentação deles é muito parecida com os que estavam presente em Rapture, assim como os Handyman são os novos Big Daddy mas sem suas Little Sisters (mas neste caso a comparação é injusta, Handyman possui animações únicas, o que queremos dizer é que é um inimigo grande, que não “sente dor” e com muita vida). Fora isso há os Patriotas e alguns outros inimigos que usam vigores. Apesar de serem pouco variados, você não se incomoda com isso, pois o cenário de combate é sempre diferente (sem contar a ambientação de Columbia ser totalmente distinta de Rapture), tornando a batalha também diferente. E a cada instante você adquire um novo Vigor ou uma nova arma. No fim, isso não se torna um ponto negativo. E fica o alerta: o jogo é bastante desafiador (depende da dificuldade, claro).

  BioShock Infinite é simplesmente perfeito. Todos os aspectos técnicos são de impressionar, a história é perfeitamente construída, possui diversão garantida e você se apaixonará por Elizabeth. A Irrational Games conseguiu novamente um jogo incrível.
  Detalhe para as DLCs "Burial at sea 1 & 2"; as conclusões finais que encaixam as peças do enredo, se tornam OBRIGATÓRIAS após o fim do jogo, é necessário que tenha conhecido pelo menos o primeiro jogo da série.
相当棒的剧情，伊丽莎白天下第一！！！！！！

[h1] Porqué la saga Bioshock es cool y tu no. [/h1]


[b] No hay spoilers [/b]
Esto no es una reseña, es más bien una opinión personal que me gustaría compartir.
He jugado la trilogía entera junto con sus DLC varias veces, en un lapso de tiempo de entre 2013-2015 hasta el año pasado que compre todo el paquete porque era lo mínimo que tendría que haber hecho. 
Y publico esto en su ultimo juego porque es justamente el más famoso y el más conocido, el que más atrae a la gente que no tiene ni idea de esta saga (y si eres uno de eso te aviso de antemano que tienes que jugar la trilogía entera o no entenderás nada).
Ahora sí, empiezo.
[b] [i] Bioshock es... especial, y muy importante para mí. [i] 




Listo, no hay más.






¿Qué? ¿Esperabas más?
Está bien.
Lista de por qué la saga Bioshock es de las mejores de todos los tiempos posibles en cualquiera realidad emulable:
* Jugabilidad exquisita.
* Narrativa excelente.
* Personajes memorables.
* Ambientación que es un deleite.
* Historia increíble.
* Gráficos hermosos.
* Apartado artístico que te deja la boca abierta y el culo como sopapa.
* Rejugabilidad infinita (O sea, literalmente esta en el titulo del tercer juego).
* Booker.
* Elizabeth.
* Big Daddys.
* Le rompe el culo a muchos singleplayer de hoy en día.
* Elizabeth bailando.
* Los hermanos Letuce.
* ¿Mencione a los Big Daddys? Sí. ¿Mencione que en el dos juegas COMO UNO? Creo que no.
* Andrew Ryan.
* Andrew Ryan cuando se enoja.
* Andrew Ryan cuando se enoja y no puede hacer un swing.
* LITTLE SISTERS.

Y por ultimo pero no menos importante: La saga Bioshock estuvo demasiado adelantada para su época. 

¿Eres un virgo edgy o un hipster que le gusta ir en contra de modas, aunque las sigues de todas maneras, y refregarle en la cara a tus amigos y amigas que sabes mucho de "cosas de culto" para parecer más intelectual? 
Entonces jugá la saga Bioshock, porque son juegos de culto básicamente, no hay mucha más explicación. 

Desde hace ya un año y medio que se viene rumoreando sobre un nuevo Bioshock, el supuesto 4. Me da miedo por estos años tan cargados de polémica por lo cual la industria a pasado, pero a la vez siento que la industria lo necesita. 


[b] Puntos positivos: [/b]
*Casi todo.

[b] Puntos negativos: [/b]
* La versión remasterizada de Bioshock 2 anda de la verga, se te crashea a cada rato y tenes que guardar partida a cada momento. No se si la versión normal también pasa. Eso es culpa de 2K y no de la desarrolladora.

(Ahre que la desarrolladora cerro equisde).

인터스텔라 같은 철학적인 스토리가 담긴 게임. 게임 내용 스포일러라던가 게임 실황 영상을 안 보고 플레이 한 덕에 더 재밌게 한 듯.
스토리도 맘에 들고 무기도 다양하고 특수 스킬들을 쓰는 재미도 있음.
총 에임이 안 좋은 편이지만 대충 쏴도 한 방에 죽는 혜자 판정 덕분에 FPS 고자도 쉽게 스나를 썼음.
맵 곳곳에 숨겨져있는 돈 같은 거 파밍 하는 재미도 있음

개인적으로 문제점이라면, 플레이를 하면서 3D 멀미가 좀 생기는 감이 있었다. 시야 각을 최대로 넓히고 해도 불편한 감은 있음.

In the vein of prior bioshock games, a sort of FPS/RPG-lite that takes place in a fantastical alternate history city. Well written and engaging game with solid gunplay mechanics. Was riveting enough that my wife actually insisted on watching me beat the game so she could follow along with the story. That's really saying something.

...BioShock Infinite... I have really mixed opinions on this game. Being a Bioshock fan really had me excited for this game when it was announced but when released... it was a very different game from the trailers. But the only problem with this game is the story, its a good story but really its just a whole mess. I didn't understand the game when I finished it for the first time I had to watch an explanation for the story and ending. But mostly it was a very good game, it had changes to the lore of BioShock and a very different feel from the first two games. The gun physics are different, it has a more heavier feel which I like but I don't like it as well. The plasmids we're changed, in this game it's called vigors which I personally didn't like. And many things we're cut out in the games release. But I rate it a thumbs up!

the gameplay and mechanics are not innovator but are fun and work. the story that is told is the heart of this game, that can be slow and extended sometimes but its incredible, except that story have great and well design universe. accomplish is that is a great game and an exceptional story. for sure its a must play of the century or at least try must play.

Este juego dura menos que sus anteriores dos entregas, pero vale la pena... anda que si no lo vale.

Una obra maestra en todos sus sentidos, con un final espectacular. No voy a hacer spoilers, pero si diré que me llamó mucho la atención en general que en Bioshock se tratasen temas tan críticos: la deshumanización, la corrupción, la lucha para el poder, el fanatismo, la religión e incluso la ciencia. En esta entrega ya podemos ver como se realzan hechos reales como la ''Masacre de Wounded Knee'', o incluso el ''Movimiento por los derechos civiles'' (sobretodo de negros), la clásica lucha del proletariado y el burgués... sobre todo la crítica a Estados Unidos (incluso en su invasión a China en 1859) solo hace falta ver su bandera en cada rincón del juego.

No hacen falta más palabras para describir lo que busca el juego. 
Sin duda una entrega que hay que jugar.
nice geam

Jogo muito bom, jogabilidade muito boa, ponto muito positivo para a historia, vale ressaltar que tem que se atentar bem a história se não acaba se perdendo um pouco, pois o jogo aborda multi-versos ao mesmo tempo. Mas vale a pena, um excelente game !

Obra de arte, que se consolida como uno de mis videojuegos favoritos.

Apartado artístico precioso, buena banda sonora, doblaje perfecto, buen gunplay y personajes bien diseñados, destacando a Elizabeth como uno de los mejores personajes que han hecho presencia en la industria.

Si a todo esto le sumas una trama increíble con un final perfecto, no sé qué más se le puede pedir a un videojuego.

10/10
Total masterpiece except the fact that jumpscare in the Comstock's house almost gave me a heart attack.

●良い点
ストーリー・世界観・声優の演技は素晴らしい。
ディズニーキャラのような表情豊かなヒロインもGOODです。
起承転結がしっかりしていて、作品に引き込まれる感覚は映画そのもの。

●悪い点
ステージの細部に至るまでの作り込みは素晴らしいが、
それ故か視界に入るものすべてがごちゃごちゃしていて
敵が見えにくかったり拾えるものと拾えないものの見分けが付きにくかったりする。

FPSやアクションゲームとして何か特筆すべきものがあるわけではないので、
正直途中から「これゲームじゃなくて映画で良くない？」と思ってしまった。

Excellent game! Especially unique DLC Burial at sea part 1 and part 2. Great story, just amazing graphics and design in Burial at sea part 2 in France!!!  Only one thing i didn't like u can't save ur game where would u like to save, u need to finish a current chapter.
 If u gonna get this game, buy DLC Burial at sea 2 parts also, there is a continuation of game story and some new plasmids and some stuff like was in Bioshock 1 and 2.
9/10.

BioShock Infinite it's a masterpiece of a game. Its blend of gameplay and storytelling make for a unique gaming experience like none other. The expansive universe and open maps allow you to truly appreciate the design of the game. The side quests never feel extraneous, and the combat scenes are challenging and require the usage of all your technology. The customization and variety of game styles allow for a unique experience every time. The mechanics are easy to understand and you will be quick to pick up all you need to know. The combat is perfectly crafted and so is the story. You feel as though you're part of this world and that it's almost real so much so that the few final scenes can invoke true emotion. This is a phenomenal game that I guarantee almost anyone can enjoy my only dissatisfaction with the game it's the fact that it's so short. Overall I'd give it a 10 out of 10

Neye mal olursa olsun oyunun hikayesi için bile değer. Sonlara doğru size ne bok olduğunu bile anlayamayacağınız şekilde kafanızı karıştıracak ve oyunu bitirdiğinizde istemsizce internette oyun hakkında ekstra bilgiler araştırırken kendinizi bulacaksınız. Sadece hikayesi de değil, oyunun sizi zorlaması, oynanış şekli sizi tatmin edecek düzeyde. Stratejik anlamda silah seçimleriniz ve vigor kullanımlarınız da oldukça önem arz ediyor.
Kaçırılmaması gereken bir oyun.

There must be some small minority of people that like Infinite, because I don’t lmao. Infinite falls over dead in the facet of world building, story, characters, and gameplay. 
   Columbia was boring. There wasn’t a lot of exploration, plasmids were almost the same, and Elizabeth does everything but help you fight. The story is wack, and these large shooting sections felt really unnatural. 
  Infinite in some sort of bad way is a well designed shooter, with an interesting story. Boring characters, interesting aesthetic and world, with narrative stumblings. It just felt like it was dumbed down, much more linear, mechanics were removed, plasm powers suck, it just brought everything down. 
               Verdict: 
          Not recommended.

Ну что я могу сказать. Bioshock infinite - это "штучная выделка". Она цепляет своей драматургией (к этому приложил руку её создатель - Ken Levine). Bioshock - это игра про историю, человеческие отношения, про персонажей - в первую очередь, конечно про Elizabeth. Elizabeth - это напарница, которая возведена в ранг главного героя.
Что касается боёвки в игре. Я бы не сказал что она слабая, просто недостаточно проработанная.
Да,Bioshock - это шутер на арене (замкнутое пространство из которого мы не уйдём, пока не убьём всех). Однако внутри каждого сражения есть "песочница" (это когда вы сами вольны выбирать какими методами будете уничтожать своих врагов).
В общем, я бы мог ещё написать про темы, через которые с нами общается Ken Levine, однако не вижу в этом смысла (так эта информация может испортить вам прохождение).
От меня эта игра получает 9/10 (один бал съела боевая система). Ну и конечно же я всем рекомендую ознакомиться с данным творением игровой индустрии. Поверьте, сюжетные повороты в игре никого не оставят равнодушным.
Это не игра, это произвидение исскуства
虽然游戏美工非常非常棒，剧情也很有意思，但玩了3个小时卡了3次，一些操作也十分反人类，每次右键想瞄准都放了技能，还有探路是N，非常累
Not as good as previous installments.  Felt like it plays on rails. Boring enemies, boring weapons.

В общем игра 10/10

Not amazing like series 1-2, but very good at all.

= Pros =
* Interesting & twisted plot with flashbacks, revelations & infinite story circling.
* Setting. Flying city in the clouds, industrial revolution, airships & automatons, landmarks of American history, quantum techs, time traveling & parallel worlds.
* Delightful graphics.
* Midbosses — firemans, creepy patriots, boys of silence, ravens, handymans.
* Not faceless & voiceless main hero & one of the best video games companions — charming Elizabeth, who is more than just npc. Fearsome & symbolic Songbird with thrilling scream.
* Some nice old time songs. Better, than in 1-2.
* Elements of gameplay — vigors & skyhook for vertical transporting.

= Cons =
* I don't like shooters.
* I don't like religious themes.
* Emporia not so stunning as Rapture.
* Boring loot system.

= 9/10 =

6 из 10. Очень упростили геймплей до максимума, из-за этого бывает скучно, слишком большие пустые локации. Карты нет, потому что всё линейно стало. Но сюжет и персонажи прекрасны. Атмосферная графика и левел-дизайн. Саунд как всегда на высоте.
